entry.title: The National Health Service (Charges, Payments and Remission of Charges) (Uprating, Miscellaneous Amendments and Transitional Provision) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the National Health Service (Travel Expenses and Remission of Charges) Regulations 2003 (“the 2003 Regulations”), the National Health Service (Dental Charges) Regulations 2005 (“the 2005 Regulations”), the Primary Ophthalmic Services Regulations 2008 (“the 2008 Regulations”) and the National Health Service (Optical Charges and Payments) Regulations 2013 (“the 2013 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Financial Services (Banking Reform) Act 2013 (Commencement (No. 8) and Consequential Provisions) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order brings into force paragraph 4 of Schedule 9 to the Financial Services (Banking Reform) Act 2013 (c. 33) (“the Act”) on 26th March 2015. Paragraph 4 repeals section 9B of the Building Societies Act 1986 (c. 53). This will allow building societies to create floating charges. This is the eighth commencement order to be made under the Act.

entry.title: The Council Tax and Non-Domestic Rating (Demand Notices) (England) (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Council Tax and Non-Domestic Rating (Demand Notices) (England) Regulations 2003 (“the 2003 Regulations”) in relation to non-domestic rating demand notices only.

entry.title: The Police Pensions Regulations 2015

ukm:Subject.Value: PUBLIC SERVICE PENSIONS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: PUBLIC SERVICE PENSIONS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations establish a career average revalued earnings scheme for the payment of pensions and other benefits to members of police forces in England and Wales.

entry.title: The Public Bodies (Joint Working) (Integration Joint Board Establishment) (Scotland) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order establishes integration joint boards for the purposes of the Public Bodies (Joint Working) (Scotland) Act 2014 (“the 2014 Act”).

entry.title: Act of Adjournal (Criminal Procedure Rules Amendment) (Reporting Restrictions) 2015
entry.summary: This Act of Adjournal amends the Criminal Procedure Rules 1996 in respect of orders which restrict the reporting of proceedings.

entry.title: The Police and Criminal Evidence Act 1984 (Codes of Practice) (Revision of Code A) Order 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Police and Criminal Evidence Act 1984 (Codes of Practice) (Revision of Code A) Order 2015

entry.summary: This Order brings into force a revised code of practice under section 66(1)(a)(i) and (ii) of the Police and Criminal Evidence Act 1984, which will supersede the existing code of practice issued under that subsection.

entry.title: The Planning (Trees) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations replace the Planning (Trees) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003.

entry.title: The Merchant Shipping (Light Dues) (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Merchant Shipping (Light Dues) Regulations 1997 by reducing the rate per ton at which light dues are payable from 40p per ton to 39p per ton.

entry.title: The Reservoirs (Panels of Reservoir Engineers: Sections under which Members may be Appointed) (Scotland) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order specifies the sections of the Reservoirs (Scotland) Act 2011 under which a member of a panel established under section 27(a) of that Act may, for particular purposes, be appointed.

entry.title: The Rates (Transitional Relief) Order (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: Changes to local government districts, involving a reduction in the number of district councils from 26 to 11, take effect on 1st April 2015. This Order provides for transitional rate relief to ensure that there is no sudden and excessive increase in the district rates payable in respect of any property arising out of local government reorganisation. The relief takes the form of reductions in the amounts chargeable in respect of district rates. The reductions will be progressively decreased over a four year period and end on 31st March 2019.

entry.title: The Employer’s Liability (Compulsory Insurance) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Employer’s Liability (Compulsory Insurance) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1999 (“the 1999 Regulations”). The 1999 Regulations specify employers who are exempted from the requirements of Part III of the Employer’s Liability (Defective Equipment and Compulsory Insurance) (Northern Ireland) Order 1972 (“the 1972 Order”) to insure and maintain insurance against liability for personal injury suffered by their employees and arising out of and in the course of their employment. The specified employers are certain public bodies; the specified classes of employer include any employers to the extent that they are required to insure under a compulsory motor insurance scheme by virtue of the fact that their employees are carried on, or are alighting from or are entering into, a motor vehicle. The exemptions specified in the 1999 Regulations are additional to those contained in Article 7 of the 1972 Order.

entry.title: The Civil Procedure (Amendment) Rules 2015

ukm:Subject.Value: SENIOR COURTS OF ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SENIOR COURTS OF ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Rules amend the Civil Procedure Rules 1998 (“the CPR”) for the purpose of implementing Chapter 2 of Part 1 of the Counter-Terrorism and Security Act 2015 (“the 2015 Act”) by—

entry.title: The Motor Vehicles (Wearing of Seat Belts by Children in Front Seats) (Amendment) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision relating to the wearing of seat belts and restraints by children in motor vehicles.

entry.title: The Rates (Social Sector Value) (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015
entry.summary: The Rates (Social Sector Value) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2007 (“the 2007 Regulations”) provide, subject to exceptions, for a person to be chargeable to rates in respect of a domestic property owned by the Northern Ireland Housing Executive or a housing association listed in Schedule 1 to the Regulations, on the basis of social sector value rather than on the basis of the property's rateable capital value. In determining a social sector value, the Department of Finance and Personnel is under a duty, by virtue of Article 23A(2) of the Rates (Northern Ireland) Order 1977, to ensure that the amount of rates chargeable is such proportion of any rent payable in respect of the property as the Department considers appropriate.

entry.title: The Scottish Road Works Register (Prescribed Fees) Regulations 2015
entry.summary: Section 112A(1) of the New Roads and Street Works Act 1991 (“the Act”) (as inserted by section 19 of the Transport (Scotland) Act 2005) provides for the Scottish Road Works Commissioner (“the Commissioner”) to keep a register to be known as the Scottish Road Works Register (“the SRWR”).

entry.title: The Local Government Pension Scheme (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2015
entry.summary: These Regulations make miscellaneous amendments to the main regulations which shall constitute the Local Government Pension Scheme in Scotland, namely the Local Government Pension Scheme (Scotland) Regulations 2014, and to the transitional and savings provisions in relation to that scheme contained in the Local Government Pension Scheme (Transitional Provisions and Savings) (Scotland) Regulations 2014. These Regulations and the other two instruments come into force on 1st April 2015.

entry.title: The Employment Tribunals and the Employment Appeal Tribunal Fees (Amendment) Order 2015
entry.summary: This Order amends the Employment Tribunals and the Employment Appeal Tribunal Fees Order 2013 (S.I. 2013/1893), which governs the fees payable in employment tribunals and the Employment Appeal Tribunal.

entry.title: Act of Sederunt (Rules of the Court of Session and Sheriff Court Rules Amendment No. 3) (Reporting Restrictions) 2015
entry.summary: This Act of Sederunt amends the Rules of the Court of Session, the Ordinary Cause Rules and the Summary Application Rules in respect of orders which restrict the reporting of proceedings.

entry.title: The Public Service (Civil Servants and Others) Pensions (Consequential Provisions) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Public Service (Civil Servants and Others) Pensions (Consequential Provisions) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2015

entry.summary: These Regulations make consequential provision in relation to public service pensions for civil servants and other public service workers and amend a previous set of regulations.
